page.title: 01Bredwardine & Brobury.
page.content: Bredwardine on the south side of the Wye and Brobury on the north form an area of natural beauty. Here in the middle Wye Valley the undulating landscape rises steeply to the south-west to nearly 900 m. It is a patchwork of fields of pasture, grain, and root crops with mixed deciduous woodland and some conifer stands. A feature is a number of large isolated oak trees of considerable antiquity, some in the centre of fields and others in the hedgerows.The fields are fairly small and the farmers and land-owners have been careful to preserve most of the hedges and copses, thereby encouraging wild-life and enhancing the scenic beauty.
